product_name: Carpet Tile With Ecoworx® Backing And Ecosolution Q100™ Fibre
product_code: See Shaw Contract’s website for specific SKU numbers
product_description: PVC-free, Cradle to Cradle Certiﬁed™ carpet tiles optimised for low embodied carbon and recyclable
standard_dimensions: •  610 mm x 610 mm  •  230 mm x 910 mm  •  460 mm x 910 mm  •  300 mm x 1220 mm  •  732 mm x 632 mm  •  711 mm x 635 mm
lead_time: Selected Styles in Stock in Australia
recyclable_percentage_description: 100% Recyclable through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program
recyclable_offcuts_description: The whole of EcoWorx can be recycled back into itself, including any offcuts.
recycling_process_description:
The core component of the Cradle to Cradle design philosophy is circularity. It is not enough to simply say that a product can be recycled - we must demonstrate that the infrastructure to recycle our product actually exists and that it is actively being cycled. Recycling of product must also optimised and increased over time.
This all starts with using the right materials, which is why material health is to critical to our brand.
reusable_description: Yes- carpet tiles can be reused especially if installed with LokDots. LokDots® are a pressure sensitive adhesive for the installation of EcoWorx® carpet tile. This non-toxic and odorless system provides an alternative to wet adhesive, virtually eliminating the issue of VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds), and providing ease and versatility of installation.
end_of_life_program_description:
Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program. At the end of its useful life, we will reclaim and recycle EcoWorx® (84 square metres or above at no cost to our customers).

https://www.shawcontract.com/en-au/sustainability/re-turn
water_reduction_techniques: Yes – recycled water is used in our facilities. Stringent Cradle to Cradle certification requirements demand that any water retuned to the environment should be equal or greater in quality than when it was drawn. EcoWorx uses solution-dyed Nylon yarn, which is uses relatively little water usage in manufacturing.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: The most carbon intensive part in the LCA of our products is raw material extraction, representing 60% of the carbon footprint of our EcoWorx® products. If we can get the product back, we bypass the need for new raw material extraction, saving that 60%. Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program.
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments:
Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. In addition, 3rd party Cradle to Cradle certification rigorously investigates modern slavery across entire supply chain.
We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.
specific_installation_methods:
re[TURN] shipments must adhere to the re[TURN] Reclamation Staging Guidelines (i.e. dry and free of non-carpet debris)

https://shawfloors.widen.net/view/pdf/w5tzjtvbi1/6.7.23-Updates_reTURN-Reclamation-Staging-Guidelines_soft_surface_v5.pdf?t.download=true&u=pg9hyw
type_of_packaging: EcoWorx is packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

certifications.rating: CRI Green Label Plus Low VOC

recyclable_percentage_description: 100% Recyclable through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program- conditions, minimums, and charges apply
recycling_process_description:
The core component of the Cradle to Cradle design philosophy is circularity. It is not enough to simply say that a product can be recycled - we must demonstrate that the infrastructure to recycle our product actually exists and that it is actively being cycled. Recycling of product must also optimised and increased over time.
This all starts with using the right materials, which is why material health is to critical to our brand.
end_of_life_program_description:
Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program. At the end of its useful life, we can reclaim and recycle EcoLogix® associated with a replacement order and a minimum of 418 m2. 

https://www.shawcontract.com/en-au/sustainability/re-turn
water_reduction_techniques: Yes – recycled water is used in our facilities. Stringent Cradle to Cradle certification requirements demand that any water returned to the environment should be equal or greater in quality than when it was drawn. EcoWorx uses solution-dyed Nylon yarn, which is uses relatively little water usage in manufacturing.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Since 2006, we have recycled 450,000,000 kg of post-consumer carpet reducing landfill waste through our re[TURN] Reclamation Program.
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments:
Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. In addition, 3rd party Cradle to Cradle certification rigorously investigates modern slavery across entire supply chain.
We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.

detailed_certifications.rating: CRI Green Label Plus Low VOC

specific_installation_methods:
re[TURN] shipments must adhere to the re[TURN] Reclamation Staging Guidelines (i.e. dry and free of non-carpet debris)

https://shawfloors.widen.net/view/pdf/w5tzjtvbi1/6.7.23-Updates_reTURN-Reclamation-Staging-Guidelines_soft_surface_v5.pdf?t.download=true&u=pg9hyw
type_of_packaging: EcoLogix is packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

product_description: Specific LVT Products: Abide, Emerge, Intricate, Kind, Terrace, Crete & Jeogori

certifications.rating: Total Volatile Organic Compounds (TVOC): Less than 0.5 mg/m3

end_of_life_program_description:
Shaw Contract are one of the leading suppliers of resilient floorcoverings in our local market that have committed to provide funding support for ResiLoop, Australia’s first national stewardship scheme for resilient flooring.
https://www.shawcontract.com/en-AU/Sustainability/ResiLoop
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments: Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.

detailed_certifications.rating: Total Volatile Organic Compounds (TVOC): Less than 0.5 mg/m3

type_of_packaging: Packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

product_description: EcoWorx Resilient is fully recyclable - optimised for low embodied carbon and carbon neutral
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments: Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.
other_comments:
Born from EcoWorx® carpet tile backing, an idea we first launched 25 years ago, the Art + Science collection is Shaw Contract's first PVC-free, fully recyclable EcoWorx™ Resilient. As sustainable as it is beautiful and designed for performance in all commercial spaces.​ Art + Science – a cycle completing itself.​​

This product is currently in process for Cradle to Cradle certification
type_of_packaging: Packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

type_of_packaging: Packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.

product_description: A stunning array of wood visuals that are reminiscent of the tranquil allure of the Nordic landscape

certifications.rating: Total Volatile Organic Compounds (TVOC): Less than 0.5 mg/m3

recyclable_percentage_description: ResiLoop is a not-for-profit product stewardship scheme that is funded by leading suppliers of the resilient flooring industry, including Shaw Contract. TThrough Resiloop, we enable a circular future for floorcoverings in Australia. ResiLoop's scheme is authorised by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission
end_of_life_program_description: Shaw Contract are one of the leading suppliers of resilient floorcoverings in our local market that have committed to provide funding support for ResiLoop, Australia’s first national stewardship scheme for resilient flooring.
water_reduction_techniques: In 2024 we used 52% less water per pound of finished product compared to 2010.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Reducing the carbon footprint of our products and operations requires a deep understanding of our entire value chain. In 2023, Shaw began delving further into that value chain by more systematically collecting data that would allow us to measure, report and set goals to reduce our Scope 3 emissions using science-based targets. Scope 3 emissions include those from the production of purchased materials, business travel, employee commuting, transportation and distribution, waste disposal, recycling of materials and products,
minimisation_design_strategy: Our design services team can provide CAD drawings, estimates and product set-out drawings to help the order and waste-minimisation process through accurate quantity selection.
modern_slavery_comments: Yes – Enterprise-wide modern slavery declaration. We are signatories of the UN Global Compact. Principle Four “Labour” states that signatories should uphold the elimination of all forms of forced and compulsory labour.

detailed_certifications.rating: Total Volatile Organic Compounds (TVOC): Less than 0.5 mg/m3

type_of_packaging: Packaged in cardboard cartons which can be readily recycled across all jurisdictions.
